text: The Solar Film (also known as A Short Film on Solar Energy) is a 1979 short film by Elaine and Saul Bass and produced by Michael Britton. ==Summary== This film takes a look at the short history of solar energy, what it is and how can it be used culturally and biologically.Internet Archive Mike Oldfield's Tubular Bells was used in the film. The film was commissioned by Robert Redford who also served as executive producer. ==Accolades== *1980: Nominated for Academy Award for Best Live Action Short Film1980|Oscars.org ==See also== * Why Man Creates, Saul Bass's 1968 Oscar-winning documentary short about creativity ==External links== * * ==References== Category:American short films Category:1979 films Category:Environmental films Category:Films directed by Saul Bass Category:English-language films Category:Solar energy Category:1979 short films
